newsitem.title: USA: American Brands' Advanced Gravis offer still open.
newsitem.headline: American Brands' Advanced Gravis offer still open.

text.p: American Brands Inc said Friday that its unit's tender offer for Advanced Gravis Computer Technology Ltd remained open despite resistance by some Advanced Gravis shareholders.

American Brands said it was not aware of more than a small minority opposed to the offer by its operating unit, ACCO World Corp. The offer for all of Advanced Gravis' shares, at C$0.45 a share, will stay open until 0001 EDT/0401 GMT on September 10.
American Brands said its offer represented a 20 percent premium over the average price for Advanced Gravis' shares.
The stock was trading at C$0.41 on the Toronto stock exchange on Friday afternoon. The company also trades as bulletin board stock in the United States.
The offer was unanimously approved by Advanced Gravis' board of directors, the company said.
American Brands said it knew of no litigation filed against the tender offer or any proceedings or investigations under way before the securities commssions of the United States and Canada.
Norm Levenson, a spokesman for a group of Advanced Gravis dissident shareholders, said on Friday that the group was seeking an order from the U.S. and Canadian regulators to halt the deal.
Advanced Gravis manufactures controls used in popular video games.
